Explanations about Options.-D(M): The database to use. This is useful primarily in an option file.
Explanations about Options.-e(M):
Execute the statement and quit. The default output format is like that produced with
 --batch. See Section 4.2.2.1, “Using Options on the Command Line”, for some examples.
 With this option, mysql does not use the history file.
Explanations about Options.-h(M): Connect to the MySQL server on the given host.
Explanations about Options.-s(M):
Silent mode. Produce less output. This option can be given multiple times to produce
 less and less output.
 This option results in nontabular output format and escaping of special characters.
 Escaping may be disabled by using raw mode; see the description for the --raw option.
Explanations about Options.-u(M): The user name of the MySQL account to use for connecting to the server.
Explanations about Options.-w(M): If the connection cannot be established, wait and retry instead of aborting.

Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Execute SQL statements in a script file (batch file)
Top-3 Scripts:
so_36570507: var="select col1, col2 from table_name where condition;"

count=$(ping -c 4 192.168.7.204 | awk -F',' '{ print $2 }' | awk '{ print $1 }')

if [ $count -eq 0 ]; then    
    mysql -h 192.168.7.204 -u username -ppassword db_name <<EOFMYSQL
$var
EOFMYSQL    
fi

so_55682304: mysql -h $dbhost -u $dbusername -p $dbpassword -D $dbname  -e " ` 
LOAD DATA LOCAL INFILE 'C:/Users/My_PC/Downloads/file_1.csv' `
IGNORE INTO TABLE my_table FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' IGNORE 1 LINES; `
LOAD DATA LOCAL INFILE 'C:/Users/My_PC/Downloads/file_2.csv' `
IGNORE INTO TABLE my_table FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' IGNORE 1 LINES; `
LOAD DATA LOCAL INFILE 'C:/Users/My_PC/Downloads/file_3.csv' `
IGNORE INTO TABLE my_table FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' IGNORE 1 LINES; "

Explanations about Options.-c(M):
Stop after sending count ECHO_REQUEST packets. With deadline option, ping waits for
 count ECHO_REPLY packets, until the timeout expires.
Explanations about Options.-n(M):
Numeric output only. No attempt will be made to lookup symbolic names for host
 addresses.
